com.googlecode.biscotti.collect

Interface BoundedQueue<E>

  • Type Parameters:
    E - the type of elements held in this queue
    All Superinterfaces:
    Collection<E>, Iterable<E>, Queue<E>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    LinkedBoundedQueue, TreeBoundedDeque

    public interface BoundedQueue<E>
extends Queue<E>
    A capacity restricted Queue. The size of this queue can vary, but never exceed the maximum number of elements (the bound) specified at creation.

    Classes which implement this interface are not required to be to be thread-safe, and should not be used as a substitute for the BlockingQueue implementations offered in the java.util.concurrent package.

    Typical implementations will define a policy for removing stale elements, or otherwise throw an IllegalStateException to prevent the queue from exceeding its capacity restrictions.

    Author:
    Zhenya Leonov
    See Also:
    BlockingQueue

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int maxSize()
      Returns the maximum size (the bound) of this queue.
      int remainingCapacity()
      Returns the number of elements which can be added to this queue before it becomes full.
